metadata.titel_preek: Providence: The Control And Care Of God

locutie.beschrijving: A narrative retelling of the Joseph cycle (Genesis 37-50) interspersed with historical reflections on American racism and the concept of Providence.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Narrative-descriptive. The preacher uses the story as a template for a general theological principle rather than a verse-by-verse exposition.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of God's hidden hand in history, moving toward a personal testimony of trust.
voorbeelden: The Bible uses the word providence only in Acts 24:2.
Joseph announces to his brothers... 'I am Joseph'.
God does something behind people's backs.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To comfort the hearer and instill a sense of security in God's sovereignty despite suffering.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly invoked as the agent of the 'event'.

voorbeelden: Providence is an important part of the vocabulary.
Joseph was seventeen years of age.
America keeps trying to forget what it is.
Judge not the Lord by feeble sense (quoted)
I can still hear the almost hypnotic voice...
Something cynical in me does not want to believe that.

commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but generalized; they function as 'truths about God' rather than 'God's specific promise to you' until the very end.

declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks more as a witness (testifying) than a mandatory (declaring forgiveness or status change).

indicatoren: Historical analysis of the Civil War.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a story or a student of a lecture rather than a participant in an encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address (2nd person) in the first 80% of the sermon.
Specific sacramental declarations (e.g., 'Your sins are forgiven').
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed engagement; the 'event' only begins in the final paragraphs.

voorbeelden: God will make perfect that which concerneth his saints.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Virtually absent until the very end.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used only in the context of 'the world may try to hurt us/you'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Joseph, Jacob, Pharaoh, America, and God.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'theological object' out of God's providence.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about God's nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The final 'I rest' and 'God will' sequence.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (History of Racism) -> Directive (Implicit: 'We must change').
voorbeelden: America keeps trying to forget... we pay and pay.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Moral analysis without a performative word of grace to enable change.

voorbeelden: On a black Friday some men did Jesus my Lord to death... I rest upon that.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition to the Commissive is the saving grace of the sermon, moving from 'talking about' to 'leaning on'.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: God acted and brought him from the dead. I rest upon that.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The section on 'irresponsibility is the sin of black America' lacks a corresponding performative word of absolution.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a long historical/narrative lecture that resolves into a personal testimony of faith. It is less a 'sacramental event' and more a 'theological meditation'.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on Tillich and Parker.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The 'event' is delayed by excessive descriptive content. It only 'happens' when the preacher moves to the cross and the personal 'I rest'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'I forgive you' or 'God says to you today' directness.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the story, but rarely the speaker of the sermon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as a 'witness' than a 'herald'.
tekstueel_bewijs: I seem to see a pattern.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the Word as information that leads to trust, rather than the act of God itself.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense 'was/did' verbs; needs more present-tense 'is/promises' verbs directed at the 'you'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Joseph said... God meant it unto good.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: What others meant for your harm, God is right now turning to your good.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a historical report to a present-tense promise.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promises are general 'God will' statements.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the second person to apply the promise to the specific suffering of the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: In your famine, God provides for you.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Replace 'people' or 'we' with 'you' in key theological moments.
voorbeeldzinnen: God is doing something behind your back for your salvation.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The sermon is not overly legalistic.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'rest' is offered as a gift before it is expected as a duty.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful narrative arc, but it risks remaining a history lesson. By shifting the 'God of Joseph' into the 'God who speaks to you now,' the performative power would be greatly increased.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his cynicism; SAT focuses on whether the 'God will provide' actually performs a promise.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric admires the 'hypnotic voice' of Powell; SAT asks if the words 'I am Joseph' create a new reality for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's weakness is not its content, but its 'distanced' illocutionary force (Assertive surplus).

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Joseph was seventeen years of age.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'talking about' God's providence rather than 'proclaiming' it until the final climax.
